messages.title: Stable Leadership for a Stronger Britain
messages.content: Britain needs a strong leader to negotiate the best possible deal for Britain with the EU. If re-elected, Julian will support the Prime Minister in these tough negotiations, while keeping good relations with our European neighbors.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: More than 3,200 apprentices have started training locally since the election. Julian will help create a further 3 million apprenticeships nationwide.
Pensioners on full Basic State Pension will receive an extra £1,250 a year. Conservatives will protect pensions triple lock and winter fuel payment.
Commitment to rebuild our secondary schools infrastructure from 2016 to 2021 and support continuation of the free school program.

Conservatives will support the NHS, committing £10 billion extra in funding per annum by 2020. Julian has fought throughout his career to take health services at the Kent & Canterbury Hospital and will work for a new medical school for eastern Kent.

mentions.candidate: Julian will support the Prime Minister.

issues.brexitEurope: Britain needs a strong leader to negotiate the best possible deal for Britain with the EU.
issues.defence: Julian has also supported rebuilding the Armed Forces and campaigned for War Widows. He is the vice president of Canterbury's branch of the Royal British Legion.
issues.economy: Since 2010, we have cut income taxes, fuel duties, and businesses, reformed welfare, and controlled immigration.
issues.education: Commitment to rebuild our secondary schools infrastructure from 2016 to 2021 and support continuation of the free school program.
issues.government: Julian will help Kent farmers during Brexit negotiations.
issues.health: Conservatives will support the NHS, committing £10 billion extra in funding per annum by 2020.
issues.labourEmployment: Julian has outlined plans to create a further 3 million apprenticeships nationwide.
issues.socialWelfare: Pensioners on full Basic State Pension will receive an extra £1,250 a year.

community.content: Julian has also supported rebuilding the Armed Forces and campaigned for War Widows.

leaflet.personalStatement: Julian Brazier was born in Dartford, the son of an Army officer from Southfleet, and was elected as Member of Parliament for Canterbury and Whitstable in 1987.

politicalExperience.achievements: Has supported rebuilding the Armed Forces and campaigned for War Widows.
Vice president of Canterbury's branch of the Royal British Legion.

images.caption: Julian Brazier with family and supporters.

examples: More than 3,200 apprentices have started training locally since the election.
Pensioners on full Basic State Pension will receive an extra £1,250 a year.
Conservatives committing £10 billion extra in funding per annum by 2020.
Britain needs a strong leader to negotiate the best possible deal for Britain with the EU.
Julian has supported rebuilding the Armed Forces.
Only Theresa May has the plan and the proven leadership.

As president of Canterbury Sea Cadets he played a key role in raising £3.7m to upgrade Herne Bay’s TS Invincible New Gap, banning so-called New Gap banning so-called legal highs and tackling the deaths of local people.
Contribution to local economy, working on the Armed Forces for Canterbury’s branch of the Royal British Legion.
Julian will help Kent farmers during Brexit negotiations.
More than 3,200 apprentices have started training locally since the election.
Britain needs a strong leader to negotiate the best possible deal for Britain with the EU.
Conservatives will support the NHS, committing £10 billion extra in funding per annum by 2020.
Pensioners on full Basic State Pension will receive an extra £1,250 a year.

personalStories.story: Julian was born in Dartford, son of an Army officer from Southfleet, and was elected as Member of Parliament for Canterbury and Whitstable in 1987.

examples: Only Theresa May has the plan and the proven leadership to deliver the right deal for Britain abroad.
Don't risk Britain's future with a coalition of chaos.
Propped up by Nicola Sturgeon, Jeremy Corbyn.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Julian Brazier was born in Dartford, the son of an Army officer from Southfleet.
nonPolicyAttributes.employment: Julian's profession as an officer in the Territorial Army.
nonPolicyAttributes.family: Julian and his wife, Katharine, have lived near Chartham since 1986. They have three sons.
